Situation1: This is the last weekend before the partner relocates abroad for months.
Situation2: They spot a child struggling in the deep end where swimming is restricted.
Story:
I had promised Mia that this weekend would be just for us. It was our last chance before she left for her new job overseas, and I wanted every moment to count. We sat together on the beach, her head on my shoulder, the sun setting in a blaze of orange. My phone was off, my lifeguard whistle tucked away—I was determined to be present, to make her feel like she was the only thing that mattered.

But then, out of the corner of my eye, I saw a small figure flailing in the deep end, right where swimming was off-limits. My training kicked in instantly. I knew the rules: safety first, always. But Mia’s hand tightened around mine, her eyes searching my face, silently pleading for just a little more time, a little more of me. My heart pounded as I stood at the crossroads of duty and love, torn between the promise I made to her and the responsibility I owed to that struggling child.
